conclusion: The graph on the left shows the relationship between pressure and temperature for an ideal gas, and the graph on the right shows the relationship between volume and temperature for the same ideal gas.
The graph on the left is a straight line, indicating that the pressure of the gas is directly proportional to the temperature.
The graph on the right is also a straight line, indicating that the volume of the gas is directly proportional to the temperature.
The ideal gas law states that the pressure of a gas is directly proportional to the temperature, and the volume of a gas is directly proportional to the temperature.
The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is 1.5 x 10^5 Pa.
